intro: Dichorisandra angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf dichorisandra, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its strap-shaped, narrow leaves. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Due to its ornamental value and ease of care, it is widely cultivated in horticulture.
